content: I noticed that the last noise run is from 2020-02-06, so it's exactly a year old by today :laughing:

What's the procedure for updating it?
I guess the link at the top of the compare page is updated manually. So should I open a "dummy" PR to rust-lang/rust, measure perf, and make a PR to update the link in compare.html to the new one?
No need for a dummy PR, probably- can just look for most recent readme update or something like that.
Does that work on a merged PR? I wouldn't want to hijack someone else's PR for a random perf run.
Every PR gets an automatic perf run once it merges. All you have to do is link to this perf run for a PR that doesn't change any code.

Oh, I thought only rollup PRs were automatically testet. Thanks!

Found a nice one: #81792 "Bump nightly version to 1.52.0" (perf run)

I'll open a PR to rustc-perf now.
